reference.title: GlassFish Configuration Settings for the Domain

Below you find a detailed description of the settings.

section.title: GLASSFISH_HOME
section.p: The absolute path and name of the GlassFish installation directory.

section.title: JDBC_DRIVER_JAR_NAME
section.p: The name of the PostgreSQL JDBC driver jar file as available after installation.
Example: postgresql-9.1-903.jdbc4.jar

section.title: MAIL_HOST
section.p: The host name or IP address of your mail server.

refbody.section:
MAIL_RESPONSE_ADDRESSThe email address used by the server as the sender of emails.
Example: saas@yourcompany.com

MAIL_PORTThe port of your mail server.
Default: 25

MAIL_USE_AUTHENTICATIONOptional. Defines whether mails can be sent only to users authenticated against the SMTP mail system.
Allowed values: true, false
Default: false
MAIL_USERMandatory if MAIL_USE_AUTHENTICATION=true. Specifies the name of the user to be used for authentication against the SMTP mail system.
MAIL_PWDMandatory if MAIL_USE_AUTHENTICATION=true. Specifies the password of the user to be used for authentication against the SMTP mail system.

section.title: MAIL_TIMEOUT
section.p: Optional. The time interval in milliseconds for sending email messages, i.e. until a socket I/O timeout occurs.
Allowed values: Any value between 0 and 4924967296
Default: 30000

section.title: MAIL_CONNECTIONTIMEOUT
section.p: Optional. The time interval in milliseconds for establishing the SMTP connection, i.e. until a socket connection timeout occurs.
Allowed values: Any value between 0 and 4924967296
Default: 30000

section.title: glassfish.domain.portbase
section.p: Mandatory. The base number for all ports used by the domain of the APPAPPAPPAPPAPPAPPAPP application. Make sure that the port base setting differs from the glassfish.domain.portbase setting for the master_indexer_domain domain by at least 200.
Example: 8800

section.title: glassfish.domain.portadmin
section.p: The administration port of the domain used for APPAPPAPPAPPAPPAPPAPP.
Example: 8848

section.title: glassfish.domain.name
section.p: The name of the domain where APPAPPAPPAPPAPPAPPAPP is deployed.
Example: bes-domainapp-domainapp-domainapp-domainapp-domainapp-domainapp-domainapp-domain

section.title: glassfish.domain.admin.user
section.p: The user name of the APPAPPAPPAPPAPPAPPAPP domain administrator.
Default: admin

section.title: glassfish.domain.admin.pwd
section.p: The password of the APPAPPAPPAPPAPPAPPAPP domain administrator.
Default: adminadmin

section.title: glassfish.domain.remote.jms.host
section.p: Mandatory. The host name or IP address of the server where the domain for the search indexer application is deployed.
Example: MyHibernateMasterIndexerHostName

section.title: glassfish.domain.remote.jms.port
section.p: Mandatory. The port of the JMS broker used by the domain of the search indexer application.
Example: 8476

section.title: glassfish.domain.admin.master.pwd
section.p: Mandatory. The master password required for accessing the keystore and truststore files of the application server domain.
Default: changeit

section.title: glassfish.domain.WS_PORT
section.p: The port used for an HTTP listener for Web service connections of the application server.
Example: 8083

section.title: glassfish.domain.WS_PORT_SECURE
section.p: The port used for a secure HTTP listener for Web service connections of the application server.

In some operational environments it is required to use separate certificates for the SOAP communication between and APP and for Web browser access, i.e. separate certificates for internal and external communication must be provided.
Default: 8082

section.title: hibernate.search.default.refresh
section.p: Mandatory. The interval in seconds between index data refresh operations. At this interval, the search index is read from the shared directory hosting the search index for the master indexer node and written to the index directory on the slave node.
Example: 300

section.title: hibernate.search.shared.sourceBase
section.p: Mandatory. The shared directory hosting the search index for the master indexer node and the slave nodes, if any. From this directory, the master search index is replicated to the slave nodes, if any.
On Windows, double-escape the colon in the drive specification of the path to the shared directory.
Example: C\\:/glassfish/masterSourceBase

section.title: glassfish.domain.stop.waitSeconds
section.p: Mandatory. The time in seconds the application server waits until a stop domain operation is executed.
Default: 60

section.title: glassfish.domain.start.maxWaitSeconds
section.p: Mandatory. The maximum time in seconds the application server waits until it checks whether a domain is started.
Default: 600
